net.proteusframework.cms.controller

Class CmsResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.cms.controller.CmsResponse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response

    public final class CmsResponse
extends Object
implements net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response
    The response for content in the CMS framework.

    This object is valid only for the current request. Do not store this object as it is no longer valid after the request is complete.

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • addBodyClass

        public void addBodyClass(String word)
        Add a class name to the body of the response. Typically, this means that the body tag of an html response will have the added class names.

        This must be called before the render phase.

        Parameters:
        word - the word to add.

      • getUniqueElementId

        public String getUniqueElementId(String desired)
        Get a unique element id.

        This should be called before rendering to ensure that the ID is not shared by other cacheable PageElements.

        Parameters:
        desired - the desired id.
        Returns:
        the desired id or in the case of a collision, the desired id with a serial number append to it.

      • hasRetrievedContentWriter

        public boolean hasRetrievedContentWriter()
        Test if the content writer has been retrieved.

        can be true or hasRetrievedOutputStream() can be true, but not both. They can both be false if neither has been retrieved or the content writer has been overridden.

        Specified by:
        hasRetrievedContentWriter in interface net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response
        Returns:
        true if the output stream has been retrieved.

      • hasRetrievedOutputStream

        public boolean hasRetrievedOutputStream()
        Test if the output stream has been retrieved.

        hasRetrievedContentWriter() can be true or can be true, but not both. They can both be false if neither has been retrieved or the content writer has been overridden.

        Specified by:
        hasRetrievedOutputStream in interface net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response
        Returns:
        true if the output stream has been retrieved.

      • isCommitted

        public boolean isCommitted()
        Test if the response has been committed. Responses may be buffered and this method can be used to determine if any data has been sent to the client. If the response is not committed, then calls to setStatus(ResponseStatus), redirect(ResponseURL), etc, may succeed.
        Specified by:
        isCommitted in interface net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • isInRedirect

        public boolean isInRedirect()
        Return true if in redirect.
        Specified by:
        isInRedirect in interface net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • isRequestForXmlContent

        public boolean isRequestForXmlContent()
        Convenience method for determining if request is for XML content like XHTML, Voice XML, XML RSS Feed, etc.
        Returns:
        true if the request is for XML content or false.

      • redirect

        public void redirect(net.proteusframework.internet.http.RequestPath path)
              throws IllegalStateException
        Send a redirect to the request path. This is a convenience method that calls redirect(ResponseURL).
        Specified by:
        redirect in interface net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response
        Parameters:
        path - the path. May be null. If null, no redirect occurs.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the requested path cannot be constructed for redirection.

      • redirect

        public void redirect(net.proteusframework.internet.http.ResponseURL url)
        Redirect to the specified url. This should be called in the processing phase. It may be too late if called in the rendering phase.
        Specified by:
        redirect in interface net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response
        Parameters:
        url - the url.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called in the rendering phase.

        Parameters:

        Set the page title. Must be called before rendering.

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(net.proteusframework.internet.http.ResponseStatus status)
        Set the response status. This only needs to be called if the status is something other than ResponseStatus.OK which is the default. For errors, call sendError(RequestError, String) to ensure that the response is properly reset and for redirects, call one of the redirect methods.
        Specified by:
        setStatus in interface net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response
        Parameters:
        status - the status.

      • setStatusCode

        public void setStatusCode(int statusCode)
        Set the status code. This is similar to setStatus(ResponseStatus) except that any status code can be set.

        Use cases:

        • Custom Status Code
        • Setting an Error Code without resetting the response.
        • Setting an Error Code with a custom response.
        These use-cases only apply for top-level PageElements or cooperating PageElements.

        Specified by:
        setStatusCode in interface net.proteusframework.internet.http.Response
        Parameters:
        statusCode - a status code.
